ladanzadelasfieras.page_title: From strategy to production | La Danza de las Fieras & Acueducto
ladanzadelasfieras.meta_description: A compelling digital experience story through cinema, web, and press.
ladanzadelasfieras.title: from strategy to production in the filmmaking industry

intro_section.title:
Act I
Aly’s first
feature-length
intro_section.p:
Alayde, better known as Aly, is a filmmaker, creative and creative director of her self-founded production company, Antítesis. Fueled by the idea that young artists can make an innovative impact in the film industry, she worked along with film production house Bala Films to create La Danza de las Fieras (The Wild Dance).

La Danza de las Fieras is a feature-length film that is raising awareness about human trafficking. It’s made up of six short films, each one focused on a different dimension of this topic. The movie was awarded five international film awards, including Best Film, and was selected in 11 film festivals in México and across the globe.
intro_section.p2: Before these amazing results and during the production process, Aly contacted Acueducto in order to review her position. She was also co-directing one of the short films, and because of the multiplicity of directors, views, and film styles she needed a strong branding to fit all the stories under one same package and a powerful website that displayed information about the film.

second_section.title:
Act II
A multi-front
cohesive experience
second_section.p: Creative and research sessions were taken alongside Aly and her team in order to craft a visual identity and branding for the film. Some shorts were documentaries and some fiction; one of them was even narrated from a phone screen. Finding a voice and a cohesive tone was the first task to take on.
second_section.subtitle: First impressions are always paramount
second_section.p2:
Part of the branding included the design and animation for the opening sequence of the film. Everyone involved loved it so much that this application stuck to be reused on the web app.

Click to watch it, it's only a couple of minutes long (and crank up your speakers, it’s worth it).

third_section.subtitle: Movie portal, the web experience
third_section.p:
Acueducto was tasked with designing a portal that would display information about the film, the filmmakers, and the press articles that would be published about La Danza de las Fieras.

During the discovery phase, interviews were made with stakeholders, producers, directors, and reporters to look for hidden needs and painpoints. These interviews threw several insights that became the core of the web strategy.

portfolio.title: Portfolio for everyone
portfolio.p: Curriculum is really important for filmmakers like Aly, films are really expensive to make and getting the funds always require a lot of trust, experience, and status. That’s why the web app emphasizes the credits of the producers, production houses, sponsors, and directors.

quote.quote: La Danza de las Fieras’ website has become part of my curriculum, now I can also share an atractive, comprehensible and exhaustive piece of work next to my reel.
quote.name: Gina Herrera
quote.label: Writer & Director in La Danza de las Fieras

press.title: Press and festivals, welcome
press.p: Press often struggles to find the information and resources they need for writing pieces about films. These publications are films’ main media outlets, so it was decided to give the press their own section with access to presskits, imagery, and the movie’s hall of fame with awards and publications. No reporter would need to leave the web app to gather additional information.

quote.quote:
Film festivals and media outlets often require a media kit from your film that needs to be organized, translated, and sent away depending on the required information.
The way our website was designed greatly simplified us the sharing of that information.
quote.name: Miguel Ángel Fernández
quote.label: Editor, Writer & Director in La Danza de las fieras

availability.title: Availability
availability.p: In film festival submissions and film screenings there is always a lot of work involved, and solving any doubt needs to happen fast. That’s why, on top of organizing all the film’s information on clear and easy-to-find chunks, the web app includes a contact feature on every page and in the fixed navigation, allowing users to effortlessly reach out if they feel the need.

third_section.p2:
Obsessing with details is worth it, especially when they add real value to the users. That is why Acueducto tailor-coded the web app in-house from the ground up to achieve a lightning-fast, lightweight, and mobile-accessible portal.

Latest technologies and tools can make users’ life easier, that is why Acueducto gave something extra to the internal distribution team and the filmmakers themselves. The website was turned into a Progressive Web App to enable offline capabilities and in this way allowing anyone to show it around even in poor or null connectivity conditions (without having to install anything from an AppStore!).

fourth_section.subtitle: What about the content?
fourth_section.p:
A powerful web app was built and the film’s premier was getting close. It was time to deliver its message in a clear, concise, and elegant way. But how? Having a unified tone and message throughout the whole experience. With this in mind, alongside the production houses of the film, Acueducto crafted the web-app’s copywriting. That way the whole narrative around the project was controlled; not just on the web app, but also in the press.

It is a common thing to find throughout press articles that the messages and adjectives of La Danza de las Fieras’ web app were used, most of them word by word.
fourth_section.stat: of press publications quoted word by word content on the web app or the presskit.
fourth_section.p2: But, is it not the most valuable result for the filmmakers to actually get people to watch their film? In film festival’s box office listings, they can compete with hundreds of other films for viewers’ attention. Most of them do not have a proper portal to hold their synopsis, credits, and trailer, and this lack of preview assets impacts the film’s viewing rate. This is why SEO for “La Danza de las Fieras” was paramount, a lot of effort was put into so that any search of that combination of words would throw the web app as the first result.

fifth_section.title:
Act III
That’s a wrap
fifth_section.p:
La Danza de las Fieras just ended its film festival tour around the world in more than 12 international film festivals in 6 different countries, and 22 press mentions across the globe endorse the film as an authority on the human trafficking matter.

The web app was crucial to position the movie in these festivals, and in the film industry in general; the digital strategy made the submissions easier both for the filmmakers and film festival organizers.

quote.quote: La Danza de las Fieras’ website was the reason Cinema23, the organization responsable for the Iberoamerican Phoenix Film Awards, found all the information needed to consider the film eligible.
quote.name: Javier Rodríguez
quote.label: Film festival coordinator

fifth_section.p2:
La Danza de las Fieras is entering it’s distribution phase as Aly and her team continue to raise awareness on the human trafficking crisis.

Supported by a powerful branding, web app & content strategy, Aly nailed her first feature-length movie touring around the world, winning visibility and pushing the human trafficking conversation from the screens to the everyday life of movie goers.

salvajenada.page_title: Where playlists meet strategy | Salvajenada & Acueducto
salvajenada.meta_description: How to distinguish your playlist from the plethora of selections on the web?
salvajenada.title: how do you share music nowadays?

intro_section.title:
Act I
Death sights
intro_section.p:
Sebastián Díaz, aka Sebas, and his crew of music tasters -including our own co-founder Artemio Pedraza- have been sharing music from around the globe for more than six years. Their canny taste has spotted breaking artists such as Tyler The Creator, Anderson .Paak, Mac DeMarco, Alt-J, Parcels and many more before they turned into indie stars. As a music-lovers non-profit organization, they have gone from blogging to arranging local gigs; from sharing news to partnering with music festivals; and they’ve done interviews, articles, and many more activities to keep their channels fueled.

But one year before we partnered, Salvajenada was showing death sights. Their social media channels where deserted, their website was outdated and slow, and all its collaborators felt like the project had already given what it had, and nobody was taking any action.
intro_section.p2: Everyone except Sebas, who’s career focused in digital contexts due to his excitement and experience in Salvajenada; he knew he had a unique concept and brand in his hands, so he met with Acueducto to explore possible solutions.

second_section.title:
Act II
The crafting of an amazing playlist
second_section.p:
The first thing was reviewing the founding ideas and values of the brand, its last actions, and their responsibilities in order to create a strong digital project. Even though Salvajenada had been afloat for over 5 years, this was the first time they developed a proper model that framed their whole business model and company values.

Finding solutions is about making the right choices. A wide-picture perspective is mandatory in order to re-frame the complications of an organization and identify highlights and opportunities.

table.label: Restrictions
table.content:
- Collaborators time
- Only work on digital context

second_section.p2:
Context analysis threw a possible solution: bring back to life their new-discoveries playlist known as #CanastaBásica -which is spanish for food basket, an analogy for the basic dietary music needs for a human being- and make it the core product of the organization.

Collaborators would just drag and drop their daily discoveries into a joint list and the rest of the communication work would be done by three collaborators who formed a team for content creation and moderation.

But how could this playlist be more special than the plethora of selections you can find on the web? By building a strong value proposition and a solid strategy around it.

table2.label: Value proposition
table2.content: Playlist updated every 15 days with new and authentic releases. An experienced team of music researchers’ selection whose goal is to break with conventional trends and create new experiences.

quote.quote: Building a business model helped us launch the project and follow through it. Amazing ideas are now landed every quarter as we adjust our future actions with our metrics at hand. This actually shapes everything we do and the responsibilities distributed in the team; we all know where we’re going to and what’s expected to happen in the future timeline.
quote.name: Sebastián Díaz

third_section.subtitle: Post, engage and spread
third_section.p:
The discovery phase threw several insights that helped build the communication plan with an incredible playlist at its core. Through conducted research and data analysis Acueducto and the team decided to use Instagram as their main media channel, and publish the playlist updates through Apple Music and Spotify.

Taking this into consideration, a plan was crafted to reach and engage with the existing audience and new possible users.

periodicity.title: Periodicity
periodicity.p: Whatever you do on social media needs consistency, #CanastaBásica is programmed to be updated every 15 days along a special selection of six Instagram posts that are micro-reviews of the best songs in the update.  Including the posts that announce every new release, this reviews sum a total of 108 posts in the Instagram feed every two quarters, an average of 4.5 every week.

meaningfulness.title: Meaningfulness
meaningfulness.p: Listeners do not just receive a new selection of the latest music releases every 15 days, but they also get context and information on the best songs of the list. As an artist, appearing in any “best of” playlist works to the promotion and credibility of the picked song, receiving an honorific mention serves as an authority badge even more.

spreadability.title: Spreadability
spreadability.p: The last point relates directly to this one. By giving artists an authority badge they could show to the world, their reviews could be proudly shared among their profiles in Instagram Stories. These featured artists shared Salvajenada’s content more than 20 times, which makes an average of one per edition. This way, Salvajenada got featured in artists profiles and reached their audiences.

multimedia_development.title: Multimedia development
multimedia_development.p: The playlist was pitched to the editorial team of Ibero 90.9 FM, the biggest college radio in Mexico, and from that moment on, every time the playlist updates the team of Salvajenada is invited to play and discuss their featured themes live on air.

quote.quote: We don’t own just a playlist that users can listen to, it’s the branded concept of sharing new music, a collection of songs that also serves as a place where you can contextualize the new music you discover (and love).
quote.name: Sebastián Díaz

fourth_section.title:
Act III
Stats and plans
fourth_section.p: The strategy was implemented and after launch Salvajenada’s profiles on social media and music platforms threw immediate and positive results in areas such as following base, reach and engagement. Take a look at the data collected after the first semester of work:

stats.small: daily email song submissions from listeners, artists, managers and PR agents
Followed by Apple Music’s and Spotify’s editorial teams

fourth_section.p2:
Motivated by these results, Salvajenada is now thinking of how to turn their following base into revenue streams, current ideas go from organizing concerts and advertising music releases, to partnering with a vinyl store to offer a suscription-based physical record delivery system.

Taking over their niche with an amazing concept, Sebastián and his crew are currently working towards reaching and engaging with more people who, just like them, love discovering new music from around the world.

And taking Acueducto’s digital consultancy and partnership to develop a web experience, a new strategy is being built to offer value to this community of music lovers through content and digital innovation.

home_page.page_title: Acueducto, a strategic design & technology studio.

landing.heading: we look for the next great digital idea
landing.tagline: Acueducto is a strategic design & technology studio based in CDMX.

intro.title: partnering with impact seeking innovators
intro.p:
As partners of Acueducto, we have witnessed the enormous benefits of co-creation and close collaboration; that’s why we cherish the importance of partnerships, and it is what we offer to our clients. Working closely together, from ideation to launch, we can produce digital experiences that truly connect with their audiences and have a positive impact on brands, businesses, and communities alike, it works like magic.

We are always thrilled by new challenges and the connections that come with them: as challenges become projects, partners become friends.

process.title:
we place strategy
at the core
process.p:
Let us share a conviction of ours:
Innovation will not materialize out of nowhere by a simple spark of creativity, but through a process that looks for real painpoints and the best way to solve them.

At Acueducto we approach challenges through strategic design, this means we work not only by ourselves but along with our partners, step by step, to develop strategies that deliver the best results for them and their users.
process.p_past:
Let us share a conviction of ours:
Innovation will not materialize out of nowhere by a simple spark of creativity, but through a process that looks for real painpoints and the best way to solve them.

At Acueducto we see problems as opportunities; step by step, and along with our partners, we use technology and develop strategies to deliver the best results for them and their users.

steps.title: discover
steps.p:
Understand the context, audience, needs, and challenges of the project.
We get smart.

steps.title: envision
steps.p:
Here we re-frame the problem to highlight new insights and opportunities.
We make sense.

steps.title: build the story
steps.p:
Create a strategy that guides concepting, prioritization, and co-creation.
We create empathy.

steps.title: design, tech & craft
steps.p:
Create prototypes, copywrite, iterate and refine designs, code, and test the product.
We develop.

steps.title: launch
steps.p:
Implement new solutions, support socialization of organizational changes and product innovation.
We drive change.

steps.title: review
steps.p:
Reflect, document, and iterate on our process and approach.
We get better.

studies.title:
tackling complex
business challenges
studies.p:
We crafted these stories to show how a strong and thoughtful digital strategy adds tremendous value to any idea.

Read about selected projects we have launched alongside our partners.

intro.title:
from ideation
to launch
intro.p:
– And everything in between.

Our favorite projects are the ones we build from scratch with our partners, that’s why we offer all the phases of digital experience development.

about_page.meta_description: Get to know us better. Read about us.

intro.title: a two-part ensemble to grow your business
intro.p:
Without us knowing, we started this studio 15 years ago when we began to fall in love with technology, music, and alternative & pop culture. Growing up together, and driven by each other’s perspectives, we would always push ourselves forward; and everytime we shared a song, a design, or a business idea, we felt fascinated by the mind of the other.

Motivated by high standards and innovation, we joined our professional paths in order to create thoughtful and powerful digital experiences.

Acueducto is not just a studio, is the result of a journey that has taken us many years to build, as our own firendship.

rodrigo.name: rodrigo salmerón
rodrigo.bio:
An interaction, visual, and motion designer and an open-source-passionate developer with an Interaction Design Master of Arts from The Harbour Space University in Barcelona and 7 years of experience as a freelancer.

He has also worked for several design firms, film production houses, and development companies.

Rodrigo is also a music producer, composer, and lyricist; and whether it’s about music, coding or human-machine interactions, he’s always looking for new challenges and trying out the latest tools.

artemio.name: artemio pedraza
artemio.bio:
A communication strategist, project administrator and community manager with five years of experience as a freelancer.

He has also gone from copywriter to community manager and marketing consultant, and he’s one of the few licenced digital communicators in Mexico.

When he’s not directing the strategy department or managing a project at Acueducto, he runs his own record label Bludot, manages artists, and tours the world playing drums for Wet Baes.

values.title:
building better
communities
values.p:
To the benefit of both final users and stakeholders, we are always looking for ways to make a positive impact with our work.

That’s why we founded Acueducto, to ask the hard questions, test the ground in which we stand, and help brands and businesses enhance their surroundings and empower their users.

work_page.page_title: Our Work | Let's build amazing things together
work_page.meta_description: Take a look at how we work and what can we achieve through solid strategies and innovative development.

intro.title:
our selected
case studies
intro.p:
Every project we develop is unique, so we hand-picked these case studies to provide an understanding of how Acueducto works and what it can achieve.

Read about the selected projects we have launched alongside our partners.

manifesto_page.meta_description: We follow these principles in every piece we create.

intro.title:
what makes
the work great
intro.p:
Years of experience have shaped the core values of Acueducto; governed by the following principles, we aim to become better impact-driven business strategists and quality-driven digital experience developers.

This is our Manifesto.

beliefs.title: We partner with you
beliefs.p: Trust us, working in partnership gets the best results.

beliefs.title: We love challenges
beliefs.p: And amazing work can happen if we analyze them together.

beliefs.title: We are quality driven
beliefs.p: If our work is not incredible, why bother doing it?

beliefs.title: We are human
beliefs.p: We put people first, working respecfully with respectful clients.

beliefs.title: We work for your users
beliefs.p: There may be times we will have to side with them.

beliefs.title: We are tech romantics
beliefs.p: Future solutions for today's problems, expect the bleeding edge.

beliefs.title: We are fair
beliefs.p: We rate our work on the added value we bring to your business.

beliefs.title: We keep learning
beliefs.p: We embrace change, a lot of times it’s part of the solution.

beliefs.title: We are always open
beliefs.p: We love feedback, hearing what you have to say is a fundamental part of our process.

cases.title:
our selected
case studies
cases.p:
Every project we develop is unique, so we hand-picked these case studies to provide an understanding of how Acueducto works and what it can achieve.

Read about the selected projects we have launched alongside our partners.

intro.title: privacy policy
intro.p:
There has never been a more critical time to reflect and act around privacy than now. Between users and technology, practices of data collection and information processes are being made; from data voluntarily provided by users to information collected just by browsing the web. In a world where interests and values vary, it has become a norm to demand a careful, transparent and ethical use of this information.

In Acueducto (“We”, “Us”, “Our”), we treat the information of the people we interact with responsibly. Here you can read about the data collection and processing practices of our site, as well as where to find the options to opt-out from them. We strongly recommend that you read this section carefully, as you should do with all the other sites you visit.

If you have any questions regarding these policies, do not hesitate to contact us at soporte@acueducto.studio

body.p1: We help our Partners (“Companies”, “Brands”, “Others”) to build digital experiences, products and services, and we often provide our services to associates who process data for their own use. This document does not reflect the privacy policies and practices of our Partners. Therefore, we are not responsible for such practices or policies outside this site.
body.p2: Acueducto processes your personal information by using our services and/or by providing any of this information to us:
body.list1:
• Full name
  • Email address
  • IP address
  • Location
  • Browser and device
  • Information about your activities on our site
  • Other information that you actively share with us
body.p3: All the information we process is acquired as follows:
body.listItem1: The contact links on this Application
body.listItem2: Emails sent to adresses ending in @acueducto.studio
body.subtitle4: special and/or sensitive information we process
body.p4: Acueducto does not intend to collect data from visitors who are under the age of 16 unless they have permission from their parents or guardians, however, we can not always confirm if our visitors are over 16. If you believe that we have collected data from a minor and you are his or her parent or guardian, contact us at soporte@acueducto.studio and we will immediately delete this information.
body.subtitle5: for what purpose and under what circumstances we process personal information
body.p5: Acueducto collects personal information when it intends to:
body.list2:
• Optimize the operation of our Application
  • Contact potential partners
  • Improve its application Search Engine Optimization (SEO)
body.p6:
In Acueducto, multiple measures are taken to protect the information it collects, such as safeguarding data in a cloud with passwords that change periodically, however, no measure guarantees that this data can fall into the wrong hands.

Rest assured that if Acueducto suffers from a security breach and your data is acquired by an unauthorized third party, appropriate measures will be taken and you will be notified about the situation.
body.p7: This Privacy Policy is effective as of September 21st, 2018 and will remain in effect except with respect to any changes in its provisions in the future, which will be in effect immediately after being posted on this page. We reserve the right to update or change our Privacy Policy at any time and you should check this Privacy Policy periodically. Your continued use of the Service after we post any modifications to the Privacy Policy on this page will constitute your acknowledgment of the modifications and your consent to abide and be bound by the modified Privacy Policy. If we make any material changes to this Privacy Policy, we will notify you either through the email address you have provided us or by placing a prominent notice on our site.

intro.title: cookie policy
intro.p:
Cookies are portions of code installed in your browser to provide the Application (“Service”) services and some of the purposes for which they are installed require your (“User”) consent.

All cookies consensually installed can be revoked at any time by following the instructions provided here.

body.p0: This Cookie Policy and its practices are governed by our
body.title1: essential cookies for the operation of the Application
body.p1: These are strictly necessary for the proper operation of the Service. This Application uses Cookies that are saved in your browser to carry out activities necessary for the operation of the site, for example, traffic distribution, language selection, etc. They do not store any personal or anonymous information about our Users.
body.title2: activities with relations to preferences, optimizations, and statistics
body.p2: This Application uses cookies that save browser preferences to optimize your experience. These Cookies, for example, are those used for the analytics of the Application. They help us improve the Service by making us aware of the actions Users anonymously take inside the Application.
body.p3: This service allows monitoring and analyzing web traffic, and can be used to be aware of the User's behavior.
body.p4:
Google Analytics is a web analysis service provided by Google LLC. (“Google”). Google utilizes the data collected to track and examine the use of this Application, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the data collected to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network.
Personal data collected: Cookies and Usage Data.
Place of processing: United States – Privacy Policy – Opt Out
body.p5: Heat mapping services are used to display the areas of a page where Users most frequently move the mouse or click, they allow us to interpret if our strategies and points of interest are working. These services make it possible to monitor and analyze web traffic while keeping track of User behavior. Some of these services may record sessions and make them available for a later visual playback.
body.p6:
Hotjar is a session recording and heat mapping service provided by Hotjar Ltd. (“Hotjar”). Hotjar honors generic Do Not Track headers. This means the browser can tell its script not to collect any of the User's data. This is a setting that is available in all major browsers. Find Hotjar’s opt-out information here.
Personal Data collected: Cookies, Usage Data and various types of data as specified in their privacy policy.
Place of processing: Malta – Privacy Policy – Opt Out.
body.p7: This type of service makes it possible to manage a database of email contacts, phone contacts or any other contact information to communicate with the User. These services may also collect data concerning the date and time when any message sent by the Servicee was viewed by the User, as well as when the User interacted with it, such as by clicking on links included in the message.
body.p8:
Mailchimp is an email address management and message sending service provided by The Rocket Science Group LLC. (“MailChimp”). MailChimp allows managing email databases and sending email messages to Users who subscribe to these databases.
Personal Data collected: Cookies, email address, first name, and Usage Data. Place of processing: United States – Privacy Policy – Unsubscribe
body.p9: This type of service helps the Application manage the tags or scripts needed on this Application in a centralized fashion. This results in the Users' data flowing through tag management services, potentially resulting in the retention of this data.
body.p10:
Google Tag Manager is a tag management service provided by Google LLC. (“Google”). Personal Data collected: Cookies and Usage Data.
Place of processing: United States – Privacy Policy - Opt Out
